A blackhead is a plug of sebum in a hair follicle, darkened by oxidation.
A nodule is a large, deep, and painful lump under the skin resulting from severe inflammation.
A papule is a small, red, tender bump on the skin without pus, indicating inflammation.
A pustule is a small, inflamed, pus-filled blister on the skin, commonly known as a pimple.
A whitehead is a small, white bump on the skin caused by a clogged hair follicle, also known as a closed comedone.
